text: Joseph Conrad said, "The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary. Men alone are quite capable of every wickedness."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Joseph Conrad

text: Emerson said, "All is riddle, and the key to a riddle is another riddle."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Winston Churchill said, "The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you will see."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Winston Churchill

text: Nietzsche once said, "When you look long into an abyss, the abyss looks into you."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Faulkner once said, "Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: William Faulkner

text: James Reese once said, "There are certain clues at a crime scene which, by their very nature, do not lend themselves to being collected or examined. How does one collect love, rage, hatred, fear...? These are things that we're trained to look for."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: James Reese

text: Einstein once said, "Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited; imagination encircles the world."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Albert Einstein

text: Samuel Johnson wrote, "Almost all absurdity of conduct arises from the imitation of those who we cannot resemble."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Samuel Johnson

text: French poet Jacques Rigaut said, "Don't forget that I cannot see myself, that my role is limited to being the one who looks in the mirror."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Jacques Rigaut

text: Rose Kennedy once said, "Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?"
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Rose Kennedy

text: Euripides said, "When a good man is hurt, all who would be called good must suffer with him."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Euripides

text: Euripides said, "When love is in excess it brings a man no honor nor worthiness."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Euripides

text: Nietzsche wrote, "The irrationality of a thing is not an argument against its existence, rather a condition of it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Shakespeare wrote, "Nothing is so common as the wish to be remarkable."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: William Shakespeare

text: Dr. Thomas Fuller – "With foxes we must play the fox."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

text: Hemingway wrote, "There is no hunting like the hunting of man; and those who have hunted armed men long enough and liked it never really care for anything else."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Carl Jung said, "The healthy man does not torture others. Generally, it is the tortured who turn into torturers."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Carl Jung

text: Robert Oxton Bolt once wrote, "A belief is not merely an idea the mind possesses; it is an idea that possesses the mind."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Robert Oxton Bolt

text: Albert Einstein asked, "The question that sometimes drives me hazy: Am I or the others crazy?"
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: Albert Einstein

text: Sir Peter Ustinov said, "Unfortunately, a super abundance of dreams is paid for by a growing potential for nightmares."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Sir Peter Ustinov

text: Playwright Eugene Ionesco said, "Ideology separates us. Dreams and anguish bring us together."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Eugene Ionesco

text: Harriet Beecher Stowe once said "The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

text: The poet, W. H. Auden wrote, 'Evil is unspectacular, and always human, and shares our bed and eats at our table.'
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: W. H. Auden

text: "Measure not the work until the day's out and the labor done."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: Roman philosopher Lucretius said, "What is food to one, is to others bitter poison."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Lucretius

text: "Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed." Genesis 9:6.
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Genesis 9:6

text: Albert Pine said, "What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others and the world remains and is immortal."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Albert Pine

text: Norman Maclean wrote, "It is those we live with and love and should know who elude us."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Norman Maclean

text: Abraham Lincoln once said, "In the end it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years."
speaker: Elle Greenaway
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Nietzsche wrote, "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: W. H. Auden said, "Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society must take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: W. H. Auden

text: Gandhi said, "Better to be violent if there's violence in our hearts than to put on the cloak of non-violence to cover impotence."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Gandhi also said, "I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary. The evil it does is permanent."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Diane Arbus once said, "A photograph is a secret about a secret. The more it tells you, the less you know."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Diane Arbus

text: Bernard Shaw once said, "An American has no sense of privacy. He does not know what it means. There is no such thing in the country."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Bernard Shaw

text: Anthony Brandt wrote, "Other things may change us, but we start and end with family."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Anthony Brandt

text: Mexican proverb: "The house does not rest on the ground, but upon a woman."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mexican proverb

text: The French philosopher Voltaire wrote, "There are some that only employ words for the purpose of disguising their thoughts."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Voltaire

text: The author François de la Rochefoucauld wrote, "We are so accustomed to disguise ourselves to others that in the end we become disguised to ourselves."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: François de la Rochefoucauld

text: Albert Einstein said, "Whoever undertakes to set himself up as judge in the field of truth and knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Albert Einstein

text: George Orwell said, "In a time of universal deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: George Orwell

text: Writer Elbert Hubbard said, "No man needs a vacation so much as the man who has just had one."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: "The defects and faults of the mind are like wounds in the body; after all imaginable care has been taken to heal them up, still there will be a scar left behind."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: François de la Rochefoucauld

text: "It has been said, 'time heals all wounds.' I do not agree. The wounds remain. In time, the mind, protecting its sanity, covers them with scar tissue and the pain lessens. But it is never gone."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: Rose Kennedy

text: "The test of the morality of a society is what it does for its children."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

text: "Of all the animals, man is the only one that is cruel. He is the only one that inflicts pain for the pleasure of doing it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Mark Twain

text: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Oscar Wilde

text: "The basis of shame is not some personal mistake of ours, but that this humiliation is seen by everyone."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Milan Kundera

text: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Helen Keller

text: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Plato

text: "It's not so important who starts the game, but who finishes it."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)
author: John Wooden

text: "The ultimate choice for a man, in as much as he is driven to transcend himself, is to create or to destroy, to love or to hate."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)
author: Erich Fromm

text: "Crime butchers innocence to secure a prize, and innocence struggles with all its might against the attempts of crime."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Robespierre

text: "If men could only know each other, they would never either idolize or hate."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: "All through history, there have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time they can seem invincible, but in the end they always fall, always."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: "Some of the best lessons are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom of the future."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Dale Turner

text: "In order to learn the important lessons in life, one must, each day, surmount a fear."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: "Between the idea and the reality, between the motion and the act, falls the shadow."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: T.S. Eliot

text: "Between the desire and the spasm, between the potency and the existence, between the essence and the descent, falls the shadow. This is the way the world ends."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: T.S. Eliot

text: "All secrets are deep. All secrets become dark. That's in the nature of secrets."
speaker: Derek Morgan
author: Cory Doctorow

text: "Evil brings men together."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Aristotle

text: "I didn't have anything against them and they never did anything wrong to me, the way other people have all my life. Maybe they're just the ones who have to pay for it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Perry Smith

text: "There is not a righteous man on earth who does what is right and never sins."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Ecclesiastes 7:20

text: "From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Socrates

text: "The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: Cicero

text: "Our life is made by the death of others."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: "If there must be trouble, let it be in my day, that my child may have peace."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Thomas Paine

text: "Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Robert Kennedy

text: "The torture of a bad conscience is the hell of a living soul."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: John Calvin

text: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow, learn as if you were to live forever."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: "There can be no good without evil."
speaker: Emily Prentiss
author: Russian proverb

text: "Happy families are all alike. Every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way."
speaker: Emily Prentiss
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: "One man's wilderness is another man's theme park."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Unknown

text: "Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself."
speaker: Emily Prentiss
author: James Anthony Froude

text: "Of all the preposterous assumptions of humanity, nothing exceeds the criticisms made of the habits of the poor by the well-housed, well-warmed, and well-fed."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Herman Melville

text: "Nothing is permanent in this wicked world— not even our troubles."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Charles Chaplin

text: "I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellect."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Oscar Wilde

episode.name: No way out 2: The Evilution of Frank

text: George Washington said, "Let your heart feel for the affliction and distress of everyone."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: The Taoist philosopher Lao-tze once wrote, "He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Eleanor Roosevelt once said, "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face; You must do the thing you think you cannot do."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "In the city, crime is taken as emblematic of class and race. In the suburbs, though, it's intimate and psychological – resistant to generalization, a mystery of the individual soul." Barbara Ehrenreich.
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Dostoyevsky once said, "Nothing is easier than denouncing the evildoer. Nothing more difficult than understanding him."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Fairy tales do not tell children that dragons exist. Children already know that dragons exist. Fairy tales tell children that dragons can be killed."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Now what else is the whole life of mortals but a sort of comedy, in which the various actors, disguised by various costumes and masks, walk on and play each one his part, until the manager waves them off the stage?" Erasmus.
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "An earthly kingdom cannot exist without inequality of persons. Some must be free, some serfs, some rulers, some subjects." Martin Luther.
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Fantasy abandoned by reason produces impossible monsters." Francisco Goya.
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "God sends meat and the devil sends cooks." Thomas Deloney
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: William Shakespeare wrote, "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none."
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "Superman is, after all, an alien life form. He is simply the acceptable face of invading realities." Author Clive Barker.
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: The noir hero is a knight in blood caked armor. He's dirty and he does his best to deny the fact that he's a hero the whole time. (Frank Miller)
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: The American poet Anne Sexton once wrote, "It doesn't matter who my father was; it matters who I remember he was."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Wordsworth wrote, "A simple child/ That lightly draws its breath/ And feels its life in every limb/ What should it know of death?"
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "No man or woman who tries to pursue an ideal in his or her own way is without enemies." Daisy Bates.
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "It is a wise father that knows his own child." William Shakespeare.
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "I know indeed what evil I intend to do, but stronger than all my afterthoughts is my fury, fury that brings upon mortals the greatest evils." Euripides.
speaker: David Rossi

text: "For we pay a price for everything we get or take in this world; and although ambitions are well worth having, they are not to be cheaply won." Lucy Maud Montgomery.
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Within the core of each of us is the child we once were. This child constitutes the foundation of what we have become, who we are, and what we will be." Neuroscientist Dr. R. Joseph
speaker: David Rossi

text: "There is no formula for success, except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings." Arthur Rubinstein
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "There is no refuge from confession but suicide; and suicide is confession." Daniel Webster
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love, and to be greater than our suffering." Ben Okri
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "A sad soul can kill you quicker, far quicker, than a germ." John Steinbeck
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us, with nothing to show for our progress except a memory of the smell of smoke, and a presumption that once our eyes watered." Tom Stoppard
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "There are no secrets better kept than the secrets that everybody guesses." George Bernard Shaw
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "If we knew each other's secrets, what comforts we should find." John Churton Collins
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: Author Christian Nestell Bovee once wrote, "No man is happy without a delusion of some kind. Delusions are as necessary to our happiness as realities."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Susan B. Anthony said, "A woman must not depend on the protection of man, but must be taught to protect herself."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another." Anatole France
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Voltaire said, "The man visited by ecstasies and visions, who takes dreams for realities, is an enthusiast. The man who supports his madness with murder is a fanatic."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Never think that war, no matter how necessary, nor how justified, is not a crime. – Ernest Hemingway
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "We all die. The goal isn't to live forever. The goal is to create something that will." Chuck Palahniuk
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Wendell Berry said, "The past is our definition. We may strive with good reason to escape it, or to escape what is bad in it. But we will escape it only by adding something better to it."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "To follow by faith alone is to follow blindly." Benjamin Franklin
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Reason is not automatic. Those who deny it cannot be conquered by it." Ayn Rand
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Thomas Fuller wrote, "A fool's paradise is a wise man's hell."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Roman poet Phaedrus wrote, "Things are not always what they seem; the first appearance deceives many. The intelligence of a few, perceives what has been carefully hidden."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Plenty sits still. Hunger is a wanderer." Zulu proverb
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Beyond the East the sunrise, beyond the West the sea/ And the East and West the wander-thirst that will not let me be." Gerald Gould
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Who speaks to the instincts speaks to the deepest in mankind and finds the readiest response." Amos Bronson Alcott
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "I think the truly natural things are dreams, which nature can't touch with decay." Bob Dylan
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "What was silent in the father speaks in the son, and often I found in the son the unveiled secret of the father." Friedrich Nietzsche
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "There is no refuge from memory and remorse in this world. The spirits of our foolish deeds haunt us, with or without repentance." Gilbert Parker
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Let us consider that we are all insane. It will explain us to each other; it will unriddle many riddles..." Mark Twain
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love." Martin Luther King, Jr
speaker: David Rossi

text: Author Harlan Ellison wrote, "The minute people fall in love, they become liars."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: P. J. O'Rourke wrote, "Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely."
speaker: David Rossi

text: "We are all brothers under the skin, and I, for one, would be willing to skin humanity to prove it." Ayn Rand
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "... For he today who sheds his blood with me shall be my brother." William Shakespeare
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Every normal man must be tempted at times to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin to slit throats." H. L. Mencken
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "There's no tragedy in life like the death of a child. Things never get back to the way they were." President Dwight Eisenhower
speaker: David Rossi

text: "No mortal can keep a secret. If his lips are silent, he chatters with his fingertips; betrayal oozes out of him at every pore." Sigmund Freud
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: British historian C. Northcote Parkinson said, "Delay is the deadliest form of denial."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Winston Churchill said, "There is no doubt that it is around the family and the home that all the greatest virtues, the most dominating virtues of human society, are created, strengthened and maintained."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Mario Puzo wrote, "The strength of a family, like the strength of an army, is in its loyalty to each other."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "And so, all the night-tide, I lay down by the side/ Of my darling, my darling, my life and my bride. In the sepulchre there by the sea. In her tomb by the sounding sea." Edgar Allan Poe
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "For those who believe, no proof is necessary. For those who don't believe, no proof is possible." Stuart Chase
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I never teach my pupils; I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn." Albert Einstein
speaker: David Rossi

text: Austrian novelist Marie Von Ebner-Eschenbach wrote, "In youth we learn; in age we understand."
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The prostitute is not, as feminists claim, the victim of men, but rather their conqueror, an outlaw, who controls the sexual channels between nature and culture." Camille Paglia
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "He who does not punish evil, commands it to be done." Leonardo da Vinci
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "There is no heresy or no philosophy which is so abhorrent to the church as a human being." James Joyce
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Fate is not satisfied with inflicting one calamity." Roman author Publilius Syrus
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Men heap together the mistakes of their lives, and create a monster they call destiny." John Hobbes
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "We all live in a house on fire, no fire department to call; no way out." Tennessee Williams
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "I have loved to the point of madness; That which is called madness, That which to me, is the only sensible way to love." Françoise Sagan
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it." Terry Pratchett
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win." Stephen King
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: Dr. Burton Grebin once said, "To lose a child is to lose a piece of yourself."
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold." Andre Maurois
speaker: David Rossi

text: "In order for the light to shine so brightly, the darkness must be present." Francis Bacon
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "No matter how dark the moment, love and hope are always possible." George Chakiris
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "I'm not sure about automobiles. With all their speed forward, they may be a step backward in civilization." Booth Tarkington
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The human voice can never reach the distance that is covered by the still, small voice of conscience." Mahatma Gandhi
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "It will become fine dust over all the land of Egypt and it will become boils breaking out with sores on man and beast through all the land of Egypt." Exodus 9:9
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it." Helen Keller
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "If there were no hell, we would be like the animals. No hell, no dignity." Flannery O'Connor
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A weak man has doubts before a decision. A strong man has them afterwards." Karl Kraus
speaker: David Rossi

text: "One need not be a chamber to be haunted, one need not to be a house. The brain has corridors surpassing material place." Emily Dickinson
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "There is no witness so dreadful, no accuser so terrible as the conscience that dwells in the heart of every man." Polybius
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Justice without force is powerless; force without justice is tyrannical." Blaise Pascal
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice." Abraham Lincoln
speaker: David Rossi

text: Kingman Brewster, Jr. said, "There is no lasting hope in violence, only temporary relief from hopelessness."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: William Shakespeare wrote, "These violent delights have violent ends."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Journalist William D. Tammeus wrote, "You don't really understand human nature unless you know why a child on a merry-go-round will wave at his parents every time around and why his parents will always wave back."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out and cast it from thee." Matthew 5:29.
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Dwell in peace in the home of your own being and the messenger of death will not be able to touch you." Guru Nanak
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "In all the darkest pages of the malign supernatural, there is no more terrible tradition than that of the vampire – a pariah even among demons." Writer Montague Summers
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: Writer Cyril Connolly said, "Better to write for yourself and have no public than to write for the public and have no self."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Man usually avoids attributing cleverness to somebody else unless it's an enemy." Albert Einstein
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "He who fights with monsters might take care lest he thereby become a monster. And if you gaze for long into an abyss, the abyss gazes also into you." Friedrich Nietzsche
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Poet Haniel Long said, "So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Where we love is home, home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts." Oliver Wendell Holmes
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." Ralph Waldo Emerson
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Men are more ready to repay an injury than a benefit, because gratitude is a burden and revenge a pleasure." Tacitus
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness but of power. They are messengers of overwhelming grief and of unspeakable love." Washington Irving
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Anything you cannot relinquish when it has outlived its usefulness possesses you, and in this materialistic age a great many of us are possessed by our possessions."
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "In life, unlike chess, the game continues after checkmate."
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: Mother Teresa said, "Life is a game – play it ... Life is too precious, do not destroy it."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Experience is a brutal teacher, but you learn. My God, do you learn." C.S. Lewis
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Oh, what a tangled web we weave when first we practice to deceive." Sir Walter Scott
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "If I am what I have, and if I lose what I have, who, then, am I?" German psychologist Erich Fromm
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when his son gives to his father, both cry." William Shakespeare
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Show me a hero, and I will write you a tragedy." F. Scott Fitzgerald
speaker: David Rossi

text: Emily Dickinson wrote, "Hope is the thing with feathers, that perches in the soul, and sings the tune without words, and never stops at all."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: Nietzsche wrote, "Hope is the worst of evils, for it prolongs the torments of man."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: Christopher Lash said, "Family is a haven in a heartless world."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Mother Teresa said, "I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Many persons have the wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose." Helen Keller
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A lion's work hours are only when he's hungry. Once he's satisfied, the predator and prey lie peacefully together." Chuck Jones
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "A sincere artist tries to create something which is, in itself, a living thing." Painter William Dobell
speaker: David Rossi

text: Gandhi said, "I have seen children successfully surmount the effects of an evil inheritance. That is due to purity being an inherent attribute of the soul."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Nature, in her most dazzling aspects or stupendous parts, is but the background and theater of the tragedy of man." John Morley
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: Ralph W. Sockman said, "Nothing is so strong as gentleness, and nothing is so gentle as real strength."
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "The single biggest problem with communication is the illusion that it has taken place." George Bernard Shaw
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The Internet is the first thing that humanity has built that humanity doesn't understand, the largest experiment in anarchy that we have ever had." Eric Schmidt
speaker: David Rossi

text: Alfred Lord Tennyson wrote, "And out of the darkness came the hands that reach thro' nature, moulding men."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "A family is a place where minds come in contact with one another. If these minds love one another, the home will be as beautiful as a flower garden. But if these minds get out of harmony with one other it is like a storm that plays havoc with the garden." The Buddha
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: Jean Racine said, "A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "I'm thankful for my years spent with this family; for everything we shared, every chance we had to grow. I'll take the best of them and lead by their example; where ever I go. A friend told me to be honest with you, so here it goes. This isn't what I want, but I'll take the high road. Maybe it's because I look at everything as a lesson, or I don't want to walk around angry. Or maybe it's because I finally understand. There are things we don't want to happen, but have to accept; things we don't want to know, but have to learn, and people we can't live without, but have to let go." Jennifer Jareau (JJ) exit interview
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: Marcel Proust wrote, "Remembrance of things past is not necessarily the remembrance of things as they were."
speaker: David Rossi

text: Mark Twain wrote, "When I was younger, I could remember anything, whether it had happened or not. But my faculties are decaying now, and soon I shall be so that I cannot remember any but the things that never happened. It is sad to go to pieces like this, but we all have to do it."
speaker: David Rossi

text: "We all wear masks, and the times comes when we cannot remove them without removing our own skin." Andre Berthiaume
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Abraham Lincoln said, "Whatever you are, be a good one."
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "All humanity is one undivided and indivisible family. I cannot detach myself from the wickedest soul." Mahatma Gandhi
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep, and miles to go before I sleep." Robert Frost
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Niccolo Machiavelli wrote, "If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Thomas Kempis wrote, "Love feels no burden, thinks nothing of its trouble, attempts what is above its strength, pleads no excuse of impossibility; for it thinks all things lawful for itself, and all things possible."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Without heroes, we are all plain people and don't know how far we can go." Bernard Malamud
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The herd seek out the great, not for their sake but for their influence; and the great welcome them out of vanity or need." Napoleon Bonaparte
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Fame will go by and, so long, I've had you, fame. If it goes by, I've always known it was fickle. So at least it's something I experience, but that's not where I live." Marilyn Monroe
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "I believe humanity was born from conflict. Maybe that's why in all of us lives a dark side. Some of us embrace it. Some have no choice. The rest of us fight it. In the end, it's as natural as the air we breathe. At some point, we're forced to face the truth. Ourselves." Penelope Garcia
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: Ralph Ellison said, "I am invisible, understand, simply because people refuse to see me."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Elise Cabot said, "Evil endures a moment's flush, and then leaves but a burnt out shell."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "When we were children, we used to think that when we grew up we would no longer be vulnerable. But to grow up is to accept vulnerability... to be alive is to be vulnerable." Writer Madeleine L'Engle
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them." Writer Oscar Wilde
speaker: David Rossi

text: "There is no such thing as part freedom." Nelson Mandela
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered. The point is to discover them." Galileo
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "No man chooses evil because it is evil; he only mistakes it for happiness, the good he seeks." Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "The best and most beautiful things in life cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart." Helen Keller
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: Friedrich Nietzsche wrote, "What really raises one's indignation against suffering is not suffering intrinsically, but the senselessness of suffering."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: William Glasser wrote, "What happened in the past that was painful has a great deal to do with what we are today."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Hunting is not a sport. In a sport, both sides should know they are in the game." Comedian Paul Rodriguez
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Nothing revives the past so completely as a smell that was once associated with it." Novelist Vladimir Nabokov
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "There's no chance, no destiny, no fate, that can circumvent or hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul." Ella Wheeler Wilcox
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "It's hard to fight an enemy who has outposts in your head." Sally Kempton
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Tomorrow, you promise yourself, will be different, but tomorrow is too often a repetition of today." Author James T. Mccay
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: Honore de Balzac once said, "Most people of action are inclined to fatalism, and most of thought believe in providence."
speaker: Ian Doyle

text: Lao Tzu said, "When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Journalist Dorothea Dix wrote, "Confession is always weakness. The grave soul keeps its own secrets, and takes its own punishment in silence."
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: Psychoanalyst Walter Langer wrote, "People will believe a big lie sooner than a little one, and if you repeat it frequently enough, people will sooner or later believe it."
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: Lizette Reese said, "The old faiths light their candles all about, but burly truth comes by and puts them out."
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: Siddhartha Buddha said, "It is not his enemy or foe that lures him to evil ways."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Poet Antonio Porchia wrote, "Man, when he does not grieve, hardly exists."
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Every journey into the past is complicated by delusions, false memories, false naming of real events." Adrienne Rich
speaker: Ashley Seaver

text: "Sometimes human places create inhuman monsters." Stephen King
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: Agathon said, "Of this alone, even God is deprived, the power of making things that are past never to have been."
speaker: David Rossi

text: Doménico Cieri Estrada wrote, "Bring the past only if you're going to build from it."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The sea has never been friendly to man. At most, it has been the accomplice of human restlessness." Joseph Conrad
speaker: David Rossi

text: "We are tied to the ocean. And when we go back to the sea, whether it is to sail or to watch, we are going back from whence we came." John F. Kennedy
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: Thomas Hardy said, "And yet to every bad there's a worse."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "What lies in our power to do, lies in our power not to do." Aristotle
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The past cannot be cured." Queen Elizabeth I
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "I do solemnly swear that I will support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic; that I will bear true faith and allegiance to the same; that I take this obligation freely, without any mental reservation or purpose of evasion; and that I will well and faithfully discharge the duties of the office on which I am about to enter. So help me God." Unknown/ FBI oath of office
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "If it is a miracle, any sort of evidence will answer. But if it is a fact, proof is necessary." Mark Twain
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Nothing inspires forgiveness quite like revenge." Scott Adams
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds." Franklin Delano Roosevelt
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone." Orson Welles
speaker: David Rossi

text: "You may leave school, but it never leaves you." Andy Partridge
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding." Khalil Gibran
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "From childhood's hour I have not been as others were; I have not seen as others saw." Edgar Allan Poe
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "All things truly wicked start from an innocence." Ernest Hemingway
speaker: David Rossi

text: "To die is poignantly bitter, but the idea of having to die without having lived is unbearable." Erich Fromm
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The timing of death, like the ending of a story, gives a changed meaning to what proceeded it." Mary Catherine Bateson
speaker: David Rossi

text: "For the man sound in body and serene in mind there is no such thing as bad weather, every day has its beauty and storms which whip the blood do but make it pulse more vigorously." George Gissing
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Adversity is like a strong wind. It tears away from us all but the things that cannot be torn, so that we see ourselves as we truly are." Arthur Golden
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Hope is faith holding out its hand in the dark." George Iles
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain." Joseph Campbell
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "We are each on our own journey. Each of us is on our very own adventure; encountering all kinds of challenges, and the choices we make on that adventure will shape us as we go; these choices will stretch us, test us and push us to our limit; and our adventure will make us stronger then we ever know we could be." Aamnah Akram
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "Things do not change. We change." Henry David Thoreau
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance." Jean de La Fountaine
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die." Joe Louis
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go." Hermann Hesse
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Three can keep a secret, if two of them are dead." Benjamin Franklin
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "There is no greater sorrow than to recall happiness in times of misery." Dante Alighieri
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "We do not suffer from the shock of our trauma, but we make out of it what suits our purposes." Alfred Adler
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on." Henry Ellis
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "At the gambling table, there are no fathers and sons." Chinese proverb
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A gambler with a system must be, to a greater or lesser extent, insane." George Augustus Sala
speaker: David Rossi

text: "For trust not him that hath once broken faith." William Shakespeare
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will leave in torment if you don't trust enough." Frank Crane
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Equality may perhaps be a right, but no power on earth can ever turn it into a fact." Honore de Balzac
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "I'm for truth no matter who tells it. I'm for justice no matter who it's for or against." Malcolm X
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Where there's anger, there is always pain underneath." Eckhart Tolle
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Live so that when your children think of fairness and integrity, they think of you." H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Love is giving someone the ability to destroy you, but trusting them not to." Unknown
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "For every good reason there is to lie, there is a better reason to tell the truth." Bo Bennett
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Memory is a complicated thing, a relative to truth but not it's twin." Barbara Kingsolver
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "Nothing fixes a thing so intensely in the memory as the wish to forget it." Michel de Montaigne
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell." Oscar Wilde
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "All that we see or seem, is but a dream within a dream." Edgar Allen Poe
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Worse than telling a lie is spending your whole life staying true to a lie." Robert Brault
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Sooner strangle an infant in its cradle than nurse unacted desires." William Blake
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "It is only in love and murder that we still remain sincere." Friedrich Dürrenmatt
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth." Voltaire
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for the good men to do nothing." Edmund Burke
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Fear is met and destroyed with courage." John F. Bell
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "I've always heard every ending is also a new beginning, we just don't know it at the time, I'd like to believe that's true." Emily Prentiss
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do." Andrew Carnegie
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A man is known by the silence he keeps." Oliver Herford
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Evil is always devising more corrosive misery for man's restless need to exact revenge out of his hate." Ralph Steadman
speaker: David Rossi

text: "If you win, say nothing. If you lose, say less." Paul Brown
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Behavior is the mirror in which everyone shows their true image." Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." Lewis Carroll
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "When a doctor does go wrong, he's the first of criminals. He has the nerve and he has knowledge." Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Body and soul cannot be separated for purposes of treatment, for they are one and indivisible. Sick minds must be healed as well as sick bodies." Dr. Jeff Miller
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." Edgar Allan Poe
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Show me your garden and I shall tell you who you are." Alfred Austin
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Better than a thousand days of diligent study, is one day with a great teacher." Japanese proverb
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "The greatest good you can do for another, is not to share your own riches, but to reveal to him, his own." Benjamin Disraeli
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "You never find yourself until you face the truth." Pearl Bailey
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I am not concerned that you have fallen. I am concerned that you arise." Abraham Lincoln
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I'm not afraid of death. It's the stake one puts up in order to play the game of life." Jean Giraudoux
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "It's easier to build strong children than to repair broken men." Frederick Douglass
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage." Sydney Smith
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for." Fyodor Dostoyevsky
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone. We find it with another." Thomas Merton
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Love looks not with the eyes but with the mind." William Shakespeare
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "The doctrine of the immortality of the soul has more threat than comfort." Mason Cooley
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I have never yet heard of a murderer who is not afraid of a ghost." John Philpot Curran
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." Lao Tzu
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: My blood alone remains take it, but do not make me suffer long." Marie Antoinette
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Sometimes the hardest part isn't letting go but rather learning to start over." Nicole Sobon
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in atime of pain or joy." Alan Lightman
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." Anaïs Nin
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The world breaks everyone and afterward many are stronger at the broken places." Ernest Hemingway
speaker: Alex Blake

text: A new command I give you, Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another." John 13:34
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery." Charles Caleb C
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I can resist anything except temptation." Oscar Wilde
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "All acts performed in the world begin in the imagination." Barbara Grizzuti Harrison
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "For darkness restores what light cannot repair." Joseph Brodsky.
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "I am dead. Only vengeance can restore me!" Terry Goodkind
speaker: David Rossi

text: "There is no present or future – only the past, happening over and over again." Eugene O'Neill
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A memory is what is left when something happens and does not completely unhappen." Eugene de Bono
speaker: David Rossi

text: "I will not say do not weep, for not all tears are an evil." J.R.R. Tolkien
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Dreams are true while they last, and do we not live in dreams?" Alfred Tennyson
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Alone, all alone. Nobody, but nobody can make it out here alone." Maya Angelou
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk." Carl Jung
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "We are not the same persons this year as we are last, nor are those we love. It is a happy chance if we, changing, continue to love a changed person." W. Somerset Maugham
speaker: Alex Blake

text: "Cruel is the strife of brothers." Aristotle
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Rarely do members of the same family grow up under the same roof." Richard Bach
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life." Richard Bach
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise." H. G. Wells
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Who knows where inspiration comes from. Perhaps it arises from desperation. Perhaps it comes from the flukes of the universe, the kindness of the muses." Amy Tan
speaker: David Rossi

text: "There are two things for which we are never really prepared for twins." Josh Billings
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "We are not only our brother's keeper; in countless large and small ways we are our brother's maker." Bonaro Overstreet
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "They mess you up, your Mom and Dad. They may not mean to, but they do. They fill you with the faults they had, and add some extra – just for you." Philip Larkin
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's future. And we are all mortal." John F. Kennedy
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too was a gift." Mary Oliver
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside of us while we live." Norman Cousins
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Life is a dream, realize it." Mother Teresa
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "After all, what is every man but a horde of ghosts? Oaks that were acorns that were oaks." Walter de la Mare
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." Mitch Albom
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins." Benjamin Franklin
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The most important thing that parents can teach their children is how to get along without them." Frank Clark
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "There is no terror in the bang of the gun; only the anticipation of it." Alfred Hitchcock
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "The greater the power, the more dangerous the abuse." Edmund Burke
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "The universe doesn't like secrets. It conspires to reveal the truth, to lead you to it." Lisa Unger
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Fear is pain arising from the anticipation of evil." Aristotle
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet." Vietnamese proverb
speaker: Alex Blake

text: "Alone, we can do so little. Together we can do so much." Helen Keller
speaker: Alex Blake

text: "People often say that this or that person has not yet found himself. But the self is not something one finds; it is something one creates." Thomas Szasz
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "To invent your own life's meaning is not easy, but it's still allowed, and I think you'll be happier for the trouble." Bill Watterson
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "Beware the fury of a patient man." John Dryden
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future." Paul Boese
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Why should we look to the past in order to prepare for the future? Because there is nowhere else to look." James Burke
speaker: Emily Prentiss

text: "When you look long into an abyss, the abyss looks into you." Friedrich Nietzsche
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Marriage is a mosaic you build with your spouse – millions of tiny moments that create your love story." Jennifer Smith
speaker: Alex Blake

text: "Each relationship nurtures a strength or weakness within you." Michael Murdock
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "There is no footprint too small to leave an imprint on this world." Author Unknown
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A mother's arms are made of tenderness, and children sleep soundly in them." Victor Hugo
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret." Salvador Dali
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Illusion is needed to disguise the emptiness within." Arthur Erickson
speaker: David Rossi

text: "It is more important to know what sort of person has a disease than to know what sort of disease a person has." Hippocrates
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils." Baltasar Gracián
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "No one is ever a victim, although your conquerors would have you believe in your own victimhood. How else could they conquer you?" Barbara Marciniak
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain, the mind must leave reality behind." Patrick Rothfuss
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "The past is never dead. It's not even past." William Faulkner
speaker: Alex Blake

text: "In matters of truth and justice, there is no difference between large and small problems, for issues concerning the treatment of people are all the same." Albert Einstein
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "He who is born to be hanged shall never be drowned." Proverb
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." Jean de la Fontaine
speaker: David Rossi

text: The name written on her forehead was a mystery Babylon the Great, the mother of prostitutes and of the abominations of the Earth." Revelation 17:5
speaker: David Rossi

text: "When truth is buried, it grows. It chokes. It gathers such an explosive force that on the day it bursts out, it blows up everything with it." Émile Zola
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "We must be willing to get rid of the life we planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us." Joseph Campbell
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "I remained too much inside my head, and ended up losing my mind." Edgar Allan Poe
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed." Irene Peter
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you can see." Winston Churchill
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "It doesn't take a lot of strength to hang on. It takes a lot of strength to let go." J.C. Watts
speaker: Penelope Garcia

text: "If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky, that would be like the splendor of the mighty one." Bhavagad-Gita, the Hindu holy book
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "We knew the world would not be the same. A few people laughed, a few people cried, most people were silent." J. Robert Oppenheimer
speaker: David Rossi

text: "What's the matter, you dissentious rogues, that rubbing the poor itch of your opinion make yourselves scabs?" William Shakespeare
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Getting rid of a delusion makes us wiser than getting hold of a truth." Ludwig Borne
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Deep vengeance is the daughter of deep silence." Vittorio Alfieri
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than any talent for abstract positive thinking." Albert Einstein
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "There is nothing funny about Halloween. This sarcastic festival reflects, rather, an infernal demand for revenge by children on the adult world." Jean Baudrillare
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Always kiss your children good night, even if they're already asleep." H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Naïveté in grownups is often charming; but when coupled with vanity, it is indistinguishable from stupidity." Eric Hoffer
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "There is a fellowship more quiet even than solitude, and which, rightly understood, is solitude made perfect." Robert Louis Stevenson
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours." Wayne Dyer
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Our moral responsibility is not to stop the future, but to shape it; to channel our destiny in humane directions and to ease the trauma of transition." Alvin Toffler
speaker: Derek Morgan

text: "Change is the law of life, and those who look only to the past or the present are certain to miss the future." John F. Kennedy
speaker: David Rossi

text: "When it comes to life, we spin our own yarn, and where we end up is really, in fact, where we always intended to be." Julia Glass
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Remove my sin, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow." Psalm 51
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "The soul that has conceived one wickedness can nurse no good thereafter." Sophocles
speaker: Kate Callahan

text: "Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad." Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
speaker: Jennifer Jareau (JJ)

text: "Death is the only god that comes when you call." Roger Zelazny
speaker: Kate Callahan

text: "As life runs on, the road grows strange with faces new – and near the end, the milestones into headstones change, 'neath every one a friend." James Russell Lowell
speaker: David Rossi

text: "The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone." Harriet Beecher Stowe
speaker: David Rossi

text: "When a good man is hurt, all who would be called good must suffer with him." Euripedes
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "The most heroic word in all languages is revolution." Eugene Debs
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "True heroism is remarkably sober, very undramatic. It is not the urge to surpass all others at whatever cost, but the urge to serve others at whatever cost." Arthur Ashe
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "Men often make up in wrath what they want in reason." William R. Alger
speaker: Kate Callahan

text: "Nothing can drive one closer to his own insanity than a haunting memory refusing its own death." Darnella Ford
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "When the prison doors are opened, the real dragon will fly out." Ho Chi Minh
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "If you want total security, go to prison. There you're fed, clothed, given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking is freedom." Dwight D. Eisenhower
speaker: David Rossi

text: "There is hardly anyone whose sexual life, if it were broadcast, would not fill the world at large with surprise and horror." W. Somerset Maugham
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Children are like wet cement. Whatever falls on them makes an impression." Dr. Haim Ginott
speaker: Kate Callahan

text: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." Oscar Wilde
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness is always there first." Terry Pratchett
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success." Henry Ford
speaker: Jack Garrett

text: "When one has not had a good father, one must create one." Friedrich Nietzsche
speaker: David Rossi

text: "We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future." George Bernard Shaw
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "Your memory is a monster; it summons with will of its own. You think you have a memory, but it has you." John Irving
speaker: Aaron Hotchner

text: "It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways." Buddha
speaker: David Rossi

text: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." Albert Einstein
speaker: Spencer Reid

text: "The world will not be destroyed by those who do evil, but by those who watch them without doing anything." Albert Einstein
speaker: Kate Callahan

text: "Life is about choices. Some we regret, some we're proud of. We are what we chose to be." Graham Brown
speaker: Kate Callahan
